page.title: 01Buckland St Mary area
page.content: Tnhis is an area of undulting farmland, scattered farm houses and buildings an small pockets of woodland. The two main areas of settlement are the villages of Bishopswood and buckland St Mary. Dairy farming is important to this area. There are also some sheep. fields are generally separated by hedges. The A303 passes through this area and is very busy in summer. the rest of the area is served largely by narrow, winding country lanes. The river yartly flows through the area and there are many small streams and springs.
